result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:32 PM Defendant Harry E Wait in court.  Attorney Thomas Michael Barrett appeared by phone for Harry E Wait.  Attorney Daniel J. Hartman JD in court for Harry E Wait.  Attorney David William Maas in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Court has received information that Attorney Gabelman is no longer the sponsoring attorney for Atty. Hartman.  Atty. Thomas Barrett is now sponsoring Atty. Hartman.
BTC: Atty. Barrett to appear in person for any substantive hearings in the future.
Motions received by the parties have been reviewed by the Court.
BTC: District Attorney's office does have the authority to charge this matter.  Attorney General's office does have legal authority to commence this action as to Counts 2 & 4.  Motion to dismiss Counts 2 & 4 are denied.
Defense counsel addresses conflict of interest claim of Atty. Gabelman.  Inquires if Court is making a finding of conflict of interest claim of Atty. Gabelman.
BTC: At this point making a finding of conflict of interest is moot.

Defense cross.

Defense has no witnesses to call.

Defense makes argument.
BTC: Testimony given, probable cause found,  bound over. 
Defense will be filing a motion requests briefing schedule.
BTC: Set date to deal with only conflict of interest regarding Atty. Gabelman.  Pleadings by the State to be filed by November 14th and Defense to be filed by November 18th.

9/12/2022:  Given the limited time slots, Court grants defendant's request.
Parties are notified off the record that Judge Laufenberg is extending the subpoena through September 19, 2022 at 11:30 a.m. to be heard before Judge Repischak

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victims R.V. and C.M. (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m. Must be completed by September 9, 2022.  NEITHER PARTY IS TO SPEAK TO THE MEDIA REGARDING THIS CASE.
